1984namespace {
1985 /// Calls the given 'operator delete' on an array of objects.
1986 struct CallArrayDelete final : EHScopeStack::Cleanup {
1987 llvm::Value *Ptr;
1988 const FunctionDecl *OperatorDelete;
1989 llvm::Value *NumElements;
1990 QualType ElementType;
1991 CharUnits CookieSize;
1992
1993 CallArrayDelete(llvm::Value *Ptr,
1994 const FunctionDecl *OperatorDelete,
1995 llvm::Value *NumElements,
1996 QualType ElementType,
1997 CharUnits CookieSize)
1998 : Ptr(Ptr), OperatorDelete(OperatorDelete), NumElements(NumElements),
1999 ElementType(ElementType), CookieSize(CookieSize) {}
2000
2001 void Emit(CodeGenFunction &CGF, Flags flags) override {
2002 CGF.EmitDeleteCall(OperatorDelete, Ptr, ElementType, NumElements,
2003 CookieSize);
2004 }
2005 };
2006}
2007
2008/// Emit the code for deleting an array of objects.
2009static void EmitArrayDelete(CodeGenFunction &CGF,
2010 const CXXDeleteExpr *E,
2011 Address deletedPtr,
2012 QualType elementType) {
2013 llvm::Value *numElements = nullptr;
2014 llvm::Value *allocatedPtr = nullptr;
2015 CharUnits cookieSize;
2016 CGF.CGM.getCXXABI().ReadArrayCookie(CGF, deletedPtr, E, elementType,
2017 numElements, allocatedPtr, cookieSize);
2018
2019 assert(allocatedPtr && "ReadArrayCookie didn't set allocated pointer");
2020
2021 // Make sure that we call delete even if one of the dtors throws.
2022 const FunctionDecl *operatorDelete = E->getOperatorDelete();
2023 CGF.EHStack.pushCleanup<CallArrayDelete>(NormalAndEHCleanup,
2024 allocatedPtr, operatorDelete,
2025 numElements, elementType,
2026 cookieSize);
2027
2028 // Destroy the elements.
2029 if (QualType::DestructionKind dtorKind = elementType.isDestructedType()) {
2030 assert(numElements && "no element count for a type with a destructor!");
2031
2032 CharUnits elementSize = CGF.getContext().getTypeSizeInChars(elementType);
2033 CharUnits elementAlign =
2034 deletedPtr.getAlignment().alignmentOfArrayElement(elementSize);
2035
2036 llvm::Value *arrayBegin = deletedPtr.getPointer();
2037 llvm::Value *arrayEnd =
2038 CGF.Builder.CreateInBoundsGEP(arrayBegin, numElements, "delete.end");
2039
2040 // Note that it is legal to allocate a zero-length array, and we
2041 // can never fold the check away because the length should always
2042 // come from a cookie.
2043 CGF.emitArrayDestroy(arrayBegin, arrayEnd, elementType, elementAlign,
2044 CGF.getDestroyer(dtorKind),
2045 /*checkZeroLength*/ true,
2046 CGF.needsEHCleanup(dtorKind));
2047 }
2048
2049 // Pop the cleanup block.
2050 CGF.PopCleanupBlock();
2051}
2052
2053void CodeGenFunction::EmitCXXDeleteExpr(const CXXDeleteExpr *E) {
2054 const Expr *Arg = E->getArgument();
2055 Address Ptr = EmitPointerWithAlignment(Arg);
2056
2057 // Null check the pointer.
2058 //
2059 // We could avoid this null check if we can determine that the object
2060 // destruction is trivial and doesn't require an array cookie; we can
2061 // unconditionally perform the operator delete call in that case. For now, we
2062 // assume that deleted pointers are null rarely enough that it's better to
2063 // keep the branch. This might be worth revisiting for a -O0 code size win.
2064 llvm::BasicBlock *DeleteNotNull = createBasicBlock("delete.notnull");
2065 llvm::BasicBlock *DeleteEnd = createBasicBlock("delete.end");
2066
2067 llvm::Value *IsNull = Builder.CreateIsNull(Ptr.getPointer(), "isnull");
2068
2069 Builder.CreateCondBr(IsNull, DeleteEnd, DeleteNotNull);
2070 EmitBlock(DeleteNotNull);
2071
2072 QualType DeleteTy = E->getDestroyedType();
2073
2074 // A destroying operator delete overrides the entire operation of the
2075 // delete expression.
2076 if (E->getOperatorDelete()->isDestroyingOperatorDelete()) {
2077 EmitDestroyingObjectDelete(*this, E, Ptr, DeleteTy);
2078 EmitBlock(DeleteEnd);
2079 return;
2080 }
2081
2082 // We might be deleting a pointer to array. If so, GEP down to the
2083 // first non-array element.
2084 // (this assumes that A(*)[3][7] is converted to [3 x [7 x %A]]*)
2085 if (DeleteTy->isConstantArrayType()) {
2086 llvm::Value *Zero = Builder.getInt32(0);
2087 SmallVector<llvm::Value*,8> GEP;
2088
2089 GEP.push_back(Zero); // point at the outermost array
2090
2091 // For each layer of array type we're pointing at:
2092 while (const ConstantArrayType *Arr
2093 = getContext().getAsConstantArrayType(DeleteTy)) {
2094 // 1. Unpeel the array type.
2095 DeleteTy = Arr->getElementType();
2096
2097 // 2. GEP to the first element of the array.
2098 GEP.push_back(Zero);
2099 }
2100
2101 Ptr = Address(Builder.CreateInBoundsGEP(Ptr.getPointer(), GEP, "del.first"),
2102 Ptr.getAlignment());
2103 }
2104
2105 assert(ConvertTypeForMem(DeleteTy) == Ptr.getElementType());
2106
2107 if (E->isArrayForm()) {
2108 EmitArrayDelete(*this, E, Ptr, DeleteTy);
2109 EmitBlock(DeleteEnd);
2110 } else {
2111 if (!EmitObjectDelete(*this, E, Ptr, DeleteTy, DeleteEnd))
2112 EmitBlock(DeleteEnd);
2113 }
2114}
2115
2116static bool isGLValueFromPointerDeref(const Expr *E) {
2117 E = E->IgnoreParens();
2118
2119 if (const auto *CE = dyn_cast<CastExpr>(E)) {
2120 if (!CE->getSubExpr()->isGLValue())
2121 return false;
2122 return isGLValueFromPointerDeref(CE->getSubExpr());
2123 }
2124
2125 if (const auto *OVE = dyn_cast<OpaqueValueExpr>(E))
2126 return isGLValueFromPointerDeref(OVE->getSourceExpr());
2127
2128 if (const auto *BO = dyn_cast<BinaryOperator>(E))
2129 if (BO->getOpcode() == BO_Comma)
2130 return isGLValueFromPointerDeref(BO->getRHS());
2131
2132 if (const auto *ACO = dyn_cast<AbstractConditionalOperator>(E))
2133 return isGLValueFromPointerDeref(ACO->getTrueExpr()) ||
2134 isGLValueFromPointerDeref(ACO->getFalseExpr());
2135
2136 // C++11 [expr.sub]p1:
2137 // The expression E1[E2] is identical (by definition) to *((E1)+(E2))
2138 if (isa<ArraySubscriptExpr>(E))
2139 return true;
2140
2141 if (const auto *UO = dyn_cast<UnaryOperator>(E))
2142 if (UO->getOpcode() == UO_Deref)
2143 return true;
2144
2145 return false;
2146}
2147
2148static llvm::Value *EmitTypeidFromVTable(CodeGenFunction &CGF, const Expr *E,
2149 llvm::Type *StdTypeInfoPtrTy) {
2150 // Get the vtable pointer.
2151 Address ThisPtr = CGF.EmitLValue(E).getAddress(CGF);
2152
2153 QualType SrcRecordTy = E->getType();
2154
2155 // C++ [class.cdtor]p4:
2156 // If the operand of typeid refers to the object under construction or
2157 // destruction and the static type of the operand is neither the constructor
2158 // or destructor’s class nor one of its bases, the behavior is undefined.
2159 CGF.EmitTypeCheck(CodeGenFunction::TCK_DynamicOperation, E->getExprLoc(),
2160 ThisPtr.getPointer(), SrcRecordTy);
2161
2162 // C++ [expr.typeid]p2:
2163 // If the glvalue expression is obtained by applying the unary * operator to
2164 // a pointer and the pointer is a null pointer value, the typeid expression
2165 // throws the std::bad_typeid exception.
2166 //
2167 // However, this paragraph's intent is not clear. We choose a very generous
2168 // interpretation which implores us to consider comma operators, conditional
2169 // operators, parentheses and other such constructs.
2170 if (CGF.CGM.getCXXABI().shouldTypeidBeNullChecked(
2171 isGLValueFromPointerDeref(E), SrcRecordTy)) {
2172 llvm::BasicBlock *BadTypeidBlock =
2173 CGF.createBasicBlock("typeid.bad_typeid");
2174 llvm::BasicBlock *EndBlock = CGF.createBasicBlock("typeid.end");
2175
2176 llvm::Value *IsNull = CGF.Builder.CreateIsNull(ThisPtr.getPointer());
2177 CGF.Builder.CreateCondBr(IsNull, BadTypeidBlock, EndBlock);
2178
2179 CGF.EmitBlock(BadTypeidBlock);
2180 CGF.CGM.getCXXABI().EmitBadTypeidCall(CGF);
2181 CGF.EmitBlock(EndBlock);
2182 }
2183
2184 return CGF.CGM.getCXXABI().EmitTypeid(CGF, SrcRecordTy, ThisPtr,
2185 StdTypeInfoPtrTy);
2186}
2187
2188llvm::Value *CodeGenFunction::EmitCXXTypeidExpr(const CXXTypeidExpr *E) {
2189 llvm::Type *StdTypeInfoPtrTy =
2190 ConvertType(E->getType())->getPointerTo();
2191
2192 if (E->isTypeOperand()) {
2193 llvm::Constant *TypeInfo =
2194 CGM.GetAddrOfRTTIDescriptor(E->getTypeOperand(getContext()));
2195 return Builder.CreateBitCast(TypeInfo, StdTypeInfoPtrTy);
2196 }
2197
2198 // C++ [expr.typeid]p2:
2199 // When typeid is applied to a glvalue expression whose type is a
2200 // polymorphic class type, the result refers to a std::type_info object
2201 // representing the type of the most derived object (that is, the dynamic
2202 // type) to which the glvalue refers.
2203 // If the operand is already most derived object, no need to look up vtable.
2204 if (E->isPotentiallyEvaluated() && !E->isMostDerived(getContext()))
2205 return EmitTypeidFromVTable(*this, E->getExprOperand(),
2206 StdTypeInfoPtrTy);
2207
2208 QualType OperandTy = E->getExprOperand()->getType();
2209 return Builder.CreateBitCast(CGM.GetAddrOfRTTIDescriptor(OperandTy),
2210 StdTypeInfoPtrTy);
2211}
2212
2213static llvm::Value *EmitDynamicCastToNull(CodeGenFunction &CGF,
2214 QualType DestTy) {
2215 llvm::Type *DestLTy = CGF.ConvertType(DestTy);
2216 if (DestTy->isPointerType())
2217 return llvm::Constant::getNullValue(DestLTy);
2218
2219 /// C++ [expr.dynamic.cast]p9:
2220 /// A failed cast to reference type throws std::bad_cast
2221 if (!CGF.CGM.getCXXABI().EmitBadCastCall(CGF))
2222 return nullptr;
2223
2224 CGF.EmitBlock(CGF.createBasicBlock("dynamic_cast.end"));
2225 return llvm::UndefValue::get(DestLTy);
2226}
2227
2228llvm::Value *CodeGenFunction::EmitDynamicCast(Address ThisAddr,
2229 const CXXDynamicCastExpr *DCE) {
2230 CGM.EmitExplicitCastExprType(DCE, this);
2231 QualType DestTy = DCE->getTypeAsWritten();
2232
2233 QualType SrcTy = DCE->getSubExpr()->getType();
2234
2235 // C++ [expr.dynamic.cast]p7:
2236 // If T is "pointer to cv void," then the result is a pointer to the most
2237 // derived object pointed to by v.
2238 const PointerType *DestPTy = DestTy->getAs<PointerType>();
2239
2240 bool isDynamicCastToVoid;
2241 QualType SrcRecordTy;
2242 QualType DestRecordTy;
2243 if (DestPTy) {
2244 isDynamicCastToVoid = DestPTy->getPointeeType()->isVoidType();
2245 SrcRecordTy = SrcTy->castAs<PointerType>()->getPointeeType();
2246 DestRecordTy = DestPTy->getPointeeType();
2247 } else {
2248 isDynamicCastToVoid = false;
2249 SrcRecordTy = SrcTy;
2250 DestRecordTy = DestTy->castAs<ReferenceType>()->getPointeeType();
2251 }
2252
2253 // C++ [class.cdtor]p5:
2254 // If the operand of the dynamic_cast refers to the object under
2255 // construction or destruction and the static type of the operand is not a
2256 // pointer to or object of the constructor or destructor’s own class or one
2257 // of its bases, the dynamic_cast results in undefined behavior.
2258 EmitTypeCheck(TCK_DynamicOperation, DCE->getExprLoc(), ThisAddr.getPointer(),
2259 SrcRecordTy);
2260
2261 if (DCE->isAlwaysNull())
2262 if (llvm::Value *T = EmitDynamicCastToNull(*this, DestTy))
2263 return T;
2264
2265 assert(SrcRecordTy->isRecordType() && "source type must be a record type!");
2266
2267 // C++ [expr.dynamic.cast]p4:
2268 // If the value of v is a null pointer value in the pointer case, the result
2269 // is the null pointer value of type T.
2270 bool ShouldNullCheckSrcValue =
2271 CGM.getCXXABI().shouldDynamicCastCallBeNullChecked(SrcTy->isPointerType(),
2272 SrcRecordTy);
2273
2274 llvm::BasicBlock *CastNull = nullptr;
2275 llvm::BasicBlock *CastNotNull = nullptr;
2276 llvm::BasicBlock *CastEnd = createBasicBlock("dynamic_cast.end");
2277
2278 if (ShouldNullCheckSrcValue) {
2279 CastNull = createBasicBlock("dynamic_cast.null");
2280 CastNotNull = createBasicBlock("dynamic_cast.notnull");
2281
2282 llvm::Value *IsNull = Builder.CreateIsNull(ThisAddr.getPointer());
2283 Builder.CreateCondBr(IsNull, CastNull, CastNotNull);
2284 EmitBlock(CastNotNull);
2285 }
2286
2287 llvm::Value *Value;
2288 if (isDynamicCastToVoid) {
2289 Value = CGM.getCXXABI().EmitDynamicCastToVoid(*this, ThisAddr, SrcRecordTy,
2290 DestTy);
2291 } else {
2292 assert(DestRecordTy->isRecordType() &&
2293 "destination type must be a record type!");
2294 Value = CGM.getCXXABI().EmitDynamicCastCall(*this, ThisAddr, SrcRecordTy,
2295 DestTy, DestRecordTy, CastEnd);
2296 CastNotNull = Builder.GetInsertBlock();
2297 }
2298
2299 if (ShouldNullCheckSrcValue) {
2300 EmitBranch(CastEnd);
2301
2302 EmitBlock(CastNull);
2303 EmitBranch(CastEnd);
2304 }
2305
2306 EmitBlock(CastEnd);
2307
2308 if (ShouldNullCheckSrcValue) {
2309 llvm::PHINode *PHI = Builder.CreatePHI(Value->getType(), 2);
2310 PHI->addIncoming(Value, CastNotNull);
2311 PHI->addIncoming(llvm::Constant::getNullValue(Value->getType()), CastNull);
2312
2313 Value = PHI;
2314 }
2315
2316 return Value;
2317}
